skill.name: find-bugs
skill.description: Find bugs, security vulnerabilities, and code quality issues in local branch changes. Use when asked to review changes, find bugs, security review, or audit code on the current branch.
skill.summary: Find bugs, security vulnerabilities, and code quality issues in local branch changes. Use when asked...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Only contains structured guidance for AI-assisted code review. No file access, network calls, or command execution capabilities. Risk-free for installation.

content.user_title: Find security bugs and vulnerabilities in code changes
content.value_statement: Finding bugs and security issues in code changes is time-consuming and requires systematic analysis. This skill provides a structured five-phase review process to identify injection attacks, XSS, authentication flaws, and other security vulnerabilities in git branch diffs.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes git diff between master and current branch
Maps attack surface including inputs, queries, and auth checks
Checks OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities (injection, XSS, CSRF)
Reviews session management and cryptographic operations
Identifies DoS vectors and race conditions
Verifies issues against existing tests and mitigations
limitations: Does not modify code or fix issues automatically
Cannot execute tests or run dynamic analysis
Only reviews files in the current git branch
Does not scan dependencies or third-party libraries

use_cases.title: Pre-commit security review
use_cases.description: Audit pull request changes for security vulnerabilities before merging to main branch

use_cases.title: Bug hunting in branches
use_cases.description: Systematically find bugs and quality issues in feature branches before release

use_cases.title: Code review automation
use_cases.description: Provide structured checklist for team members to perform consistent security reviews

prompt_templates.title: Basic bug search
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the find-bugs skill to review the current branch for any bugs or security issues in the changed files.

prompt_templates.title: Security focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Use find-bugs to perform a security audit on my branch changes. Prioritize security vulnerabilities over other issues.

prompt_templates.title: Full review
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a complete find-bugs review on my branch. Check all items in the security checklist and report findings with severity levels.

prompt_templates.title: Quick scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Quick find-bugs scan for critical or high severity issues in my branch changes. Skip low-priority items.

best_practices: Run before merging any security-sensitive PRs to main branch
Combine with manual review for complex business logic edge cases
Use output evidence to write regression tests for discovered issues
anti_patterns: Using for stylistic issues rather than security and functional bugs
Ignoring findings marked as unverified without additional context review
Skipping Phase 1 complete input gathering when diff output is large

faq.question: What programming languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: Language agnostic. Works with any language by reviewing git diff for common vulnerability patterns.

faq.question: What is the maximum file count it can review?
faq.answer: No limit. Processes all files in the current branch. Very large diffs may take longer to analyze.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Not directly. Run it locally or in a code review step before CI. Results are text output for documentation.

faq.question: Does this skill send code to external services?
faq.answer: No. All analysis happens locally within the AI. No external network calls are made during review.

faq.question: Why are some issues marked as unverified?
faq.answer: When evidence is incomplete or the issue might be handled elsewhere. Review Phase 4 guidance for verification steps.

faq.question: How does this compare to automated scanners like SonarQube?
faq.answer: This skill provides human-readable analysis with context awareness. Automated scanners catch known patterns but miss logic flaws.
